title: Test Natural Materials for Cordage
brief: Perform simple tests to determine if natural materials are suitable for making cordage.
steps: Step 1: Pull on a length of the material to test its tensile strength.
Step 2: Twist the material between your fingers and roll the fibers together.
Step 3: If it withstands handling without snapping apart, proceed to next test.
Step 4: Tie an overhand knot with the fibers.
Step 5: Gently tighten the knot - if it doesn't break, the material is suitable for cordage.
warnings: Test materials thoroughly before depending on them for critical applications.
Even suitable materials may have weak points - inspect the entire length.
Different parts of the same plant may have different strength characteristics.
